website_summaries.verdict: Very reasonably priced set of 4 child-safety doorknob covers, made by manufacturer of several other baby/child-safety products.
pros: Compatible with standard round doorknobs and manufacturer claims these covers fit more doorknobs than any competing product
Opening for keyhole and easy gripping access for adults
White and subdued design, so won't detract from your home décor
Easy installation by simply snapping into place
cons: Determined toddlers might be able to rip these covers off the doorknobs
Not effective on extra-small knobs, because adults can't turn the doorknob either

customer_reviews.title: Escape artist daughter almost won... ALMOST
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a world-renowned escape artist. She figured out how to pull these off our doorknobs the very day that I installed them, but because she gets her stubbornness from me, I wasn't going to relent. I put little pieces of packing tape on both seams and now they work wonderfully! They are easy for adults to use but are also great for keeping small children out of areas they shouldn't go. We have standard sized doorknobs and these fit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: broxhouse

customer_reviews.title: Right on Time!
customer_reviews.text: Right on Time! Our 2 yo recently discovered that he can open the door knobs (every door knob in the house) and loves opening and closing the doors with the catch phrase "good bye, see ya next time" (yes it is absolutely adorable, but...). Since installing these door knob covers he cannot randomly close himself in closets or Houdini his way out of his room. lol The door knob covers are hard plastic and snap together pretty well so your child won't be able to pry it off.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Dee A Vee I Ess

customer_reviews.title: they work great for keeping him from opening the basement stairs door
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my father who has Alzheimer's disease... they work great for keeping him from opening the basement stairs door.
customer_reviews.author: Nursemom

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: My three year old can’t figure these out. I’m not sure why people are saying their kids can remove these from the handle completely, I have a really difficult time taking them off as an adult. But opening doors is a breeze for adults, not for kids. Super happy knowing my kid can’t break out of my house at any moment.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Working great!
customer_reviews.text: When I first put the cover on my bathroom door knob my son immediately opened it and I was extremely upset as I bought two separate packages of door knob covers and it appeared neither of them were working but it was sheer luck that he got it open that first time he just happened to put his thumb through the hole because ever since then he hasn't been able to open it. It twists and twists every time he grabs a hold of it and so he's given up trying because he knows he can't get in, it's been a wonderful deterrent! Thanks to this door knob cover my son is no longer playing in the toilet!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Wasted time and money
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit the doorknob at all. And they would not pay return shipping. Wasted time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia S

customer_reviews.title: Works great for keeping my strong
customer_reviews.text: Works great for keeping my strong, ornery 2 year old safe! Before I found these he was waking up in the mornings before me & going downstairs by himself & sometimes opening the main doors to the outside...very scary! These have been such a game changer for me & given us such relief! Sooo happy I found these...tried a few other brands too & he was able to pull those off!
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaComet

customer_reviews.title: Works, with modifications
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old popped this off within seconds, so I was going to give it 1 star. I used some duct tape to hold it closed, and he can’t get it off. So it kind of works.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Howard

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool for caregivers of dementia patients.
customer_reviews.text: My significant there is a caregiver for an elderly relative who also suffers from dementia/severe memory problems. During restless night, this person tends to wanders into rooms that are dangerous for them to be in unsupervised (bathrooms with hard surfaces, closets full of items). This has caused several injuries including broken hips and numerous hospital stays. I found these on Amazon and they work great! Makes things a little easier on the caregiver because they can sleep better without worrying about the person going into dangerous rooms in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: A.Nova

customer_reviews.title: Maybe suitable for babies?
customer_reviews.text: My toddler opened the door within 2 minutes of me putting these on. I was really looking forward to taking a poo in private for the first time in 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: L. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to keep my toddler out of certain places. I love how smooth and streamline they look, unlike some other brands that have more bumps and latch type parts on the knob covers. Very easy to snap together and the holes for adult fingers is large enough for easy opening. I'm buying more tonight!
customer_reviews.author: Lesley

customer_reviews.title: Looks as good as knob covers can, hard for toddlers, easy for adults
customer_reviews.text: These covers are definitely well-designed. They are easy for adults and older children to maneuver but my 2 year old can't turn the knobs when this is on. They look great, kind of a shiny plastic that looks better in a home than cheap 'kid' plastic like the Munchkin brand. We have black knobs in our home, and while these look as nice as knob covers can look, I would like to have had options for a black knob cover to be less noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: I cant open the door
customer_reviews.text: I'm a normal size human adult male and I'm the only one in the household that can get the door open with these things on, and even then just with my good hand and after 6 tries. Its not childproof, its people-proof. Maybe my doorknobs are too small or maybe they are too hard to turn, or maybe the holes in the plastic are too small to get a good grip. Either way these end up on the floor after my frustrated wife cant get the door open.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ramsell

customer_reviews.title: Borderline adultproof!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have kids (Amazon, please, stop with the attempted targeted advertising based on this purchase...), but I do have a CAT who figured out how doorknobs work, so this has been a great way to keep her out of my home office and bathroom and limit the feline chaos. Especially since your hands have to be totally dry to make it work! (I also sometimes need to keep the cats IN the bathroom, and nearly got stuck in there a couple times from post-shower condensation on the doorknob!) But hey, at least I know I'll have my privacy!
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Simple and works well.
customer_reviews.text: They work well. Sometimes when you're taking them off (which I had to do while showing my house to sell), the little tabs will snap off.. but the cover still snaps on, so I guess it's not a big deal. I also wish they were easier to get off, but most people are probably not going to need to remove these until the kids are old enough that they're no longer needed. They're easy to get onto doorknobs.
customer_reviews.author: V. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Useful and easy to install, seems reasonably durable
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these covers when our 2 year old started to figure out how to open door knobs. The covers are a relatively simple design, they snap together around the door knob. The child tries to turn the knob, turns the cover instead. A knowledgeable adult knows to stick their fingers through the holes in the door knob cover, but the child does not know that. Once again, the adults return to having magic powers. It is probably only a matter of time before the 2yr old figures these out and returns to unwanted opening of doors. Childproofing is a never-ending arms race.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Proof
customer_reviews.text: These have kept the toddler at bay, but everyone else struggles to use the door knobs too. Our 11 and 8 year olds have a hard time as do my husband and myself. It might be our knob shape. If you have a more barrel or or round knob they might work better but on our slightly triangle shaped knobs they are really difficult to use. They are flimsy and come off easily as well. Compared with the covers that yoi
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T. Scheffrahn

customer_reviews.title: Great and simple!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased another commonly found brand and they didn't fit any of the knobs in the house. Not to mention, they popped open very easily when I was trying to work with them. HOWEVER, this product fit well, went on easily and I have to work to get them off the knobs so I am very pleased to know my son won't be able to remove them on his own. I only purchased one package because I was afraid of them having the same problem because they're priced very nicely. Very satisfied and I am going to order more for the rest of the knobs. Thank you for a product that works!!
customer_reviews.author: kelley4yaFACE

customer_reviews.title: Product will not keep a two year old from opening doors, to cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: This product had good reviews and was shipped and delivered as promised. One big problem, my 2 year can pull down hard enough on the door knob cover to break it off the door. So whole purpose of keeping my child from opening doors this product fails miserably. The plastic tabs are just not strong enough to keep the two havles together...
customer_reviews.author: The McElroys

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: These knobs are so hard for a grown person to use. Yes easy to install/assemble and really have nothing on them that can break...but they are incredibly awkward to use...too hard to get my fingers in the holes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great price for this gadget
customer_reviews.text: I've got this for my husband who has Alzheimer's and constantly tries to leave the house without his aides or myself. Having this in place made it harder for him (also the Wdsam alarm) - he couldn't figure out how to turn the knob. Granted, he did get it open a couple of times but it was by luck, not because he figured it out. This will work depends on the age/ the intelligence of the person. I added an alarm for when he was able to turn the knob - an extra obstacle can't hurt
customer_reviews.author: MellowY

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: These do exactly what I needed them to do. My son, who is 2 1/2 years old, learned to open doors. He was constantly going into his sister's room plus occasionally opening outside doors and the basement door. Now he can not open anything we don't want him to! Only problem is they are hard plastic so you have get your fingers in the wholes and grip the knob to open. I was hoping they would just be a material I could squeeze and turn.
customer_reviews.author: Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit standard indoor or outdoor doorknobs.  Simply won't work for any standard doorknobs.
customer_reviews.text: These incredibly small covers do not fit any doors in the house. Indoor bathroom (standard brass) knobs, outdoor (brass and aluminium) , older pewter ones- nothing! Not a single one. The neck is far too small to actually snap around any of the knobs for one, and secondly even if I could manage to cinch any of the baskets closed- it would be so tight it wouldn't serve its purpose. The flexible plastic would be so tight against nearly any knob, that it would be stuck to the knob no matter what- rendering it useless for its purpose. Basically a terrible design- too small of a basket to fit any standard knobs, bad choice of material. Being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Physick

customer_reviews.title: It works, but definitely bottom grade.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. Definitely on the cheap end for material. I probably should have searched for different styles, seeing now that there are other products with "squeeze" grips v. the side slots. Those seem preferable in terms of better comfort and grip. This product requires a firm grasp of the knob using the small amount of space that allows for it. This would most likely be painful for anyone with arthritis, carpal tunnel, or anything else that would cause pain when applying pressure to turn a knob with two fingers.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: If Safety First brand didn’t fit your doorknob, try this one!!
customer_reviews.text: Had to try a few different versions before finding the one that fit my doorknob. This one is it!! My 2 yr old has given up trying to open the door. Big win!! I work from home and had to keep the toddler outside of my office with stay at home dad. This has been great for us. I haven’t figured out how to remove or open the ones that came attached in the box so I used the ones that were open already. Won’t need to remove any time soon, no biggie.
customer_reviews.author: Heisha

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This door knob cover does the job. My son is unable to open the door and I like its simple design. It's easy to use (even for grandparents). The only negative is that the size of the cover is really big compare to the door knob I have so it's very loose. However, like I said before, it does the job and I am overall happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: excellent and so helpful keeping my mom safe
customer_reviews.text: excellent and so helpful keeping my mom safe. thank you. i did not know what i needed but these are very helpful
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dre

customer_reviews.title: Not the best first impression, but works!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these, I thought they were too cheap feeling and looking. They are made of hard plastic and clip together. I needed them to keep 3 toddlers out of my work room. I was hesitant that they would work, but lo and behold I heard the frustrated cries of the toddlers over and over again as they were unable to enter my work study. These are the greatest things ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, Hard to remove
customer_reviews.text: These covers do the trick. You do not need to squeeze to turn the knobs like other similar devices, you just need to grip the knob through the access holes in the device. It makes the knobs impossible to open for my toddler and only marginally more challenging for me to open. They install quickly - they come in two sections that just snap on around the knob. It seems like they're really loose, but that's the whole point - they spin around the knob if you don't reach for the knob between the plastic. My only complaint is that they're challenging to remove, even for adults.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, with tape
customer_reviews.text: This child door lock works fine, as long as you place tape over the seams. Without tape, my three year old broke it off after two minutes. He doesn’t have the fine motor skills to peel the tape off, so it works great now.
customer_reviews.author: alamanna

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2 year old, and she gets into everything. She knows how to open all our doors. We keep them shut but she goes right in. We were so scared she would get in the bathroom at night and play in the bath (she can turn the water on too.) Or toilet. We bought these door knob covers and they are AMAZING. It takes so much stress of this momma. We bought a extra set to put them on a few more doors and just love them. My two year old can't figure them out. My 7 year olds can use them just fine. They love that their sister can't come play Godzilla with their rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: They work and might be available at ‘Tar Get’ for others.
customer_reviews.text: These work. They’re inexpensive and they fit my doorknobs. My wife complains they sit too far away from the doorknob itself so it’s harder for her to actually open the door. I thought they were the same ones our daycare used because I have no idea what I’m buying. If you have fake nails or long nails these might not be the best option. I bought them because I’m a cheap dad and didn’t know where else to buy them. Apparently there is this red store named ‘Tar Get’ or something like that where I could buy a similar product and return if unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and effective, but annoying
customer_reviews.text: These are annoying but effective. Sometimes I struggle to turn the door knobs myself. You have to stick your fingers in the holes to grip the knob. I also wouldn't say it's the easiest thing to take apart. I always feel like I'm going to break them, but they have not broke yet so that's a good sign. I wanted something cheap and effective and these are.
customer_reviews.author: Heaven

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, to slick some times to open, almost a 5 star
customer_reviews.text: The system works, the set up is easy, and they have worked for a good wile for us now. The biggest issue is they are slick, and even as an adult i can't get the door knob open. The people in our home have learned the skill but when guests come over its like watching a monkey discover fire for the first time. Thy should have some texture on the outside and the inside so you can get a quick intuitive grip without having to think about it. Well worth the price, good product, just cant give something a 5 star when its missing such an important and easily modified item.
customer_reviews.author: Breanne O.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly the way I’d hoped! My son just turned two, and he has a newfound love for trying to open all the doors in the house! These knob covers are extremely easy to install, and my son can’t turn the knob at ALL, so they definitely do what they’re supposed to do. The only issue I have is the material. They’re plastic, so they’re no grip to open the door, apart from the little holes to grip the doorknob. I wish there were rubber pads to squeeze or something to make it easier for the adults. Other than that, they work well!
customer_reviews.author: Tryphaena

customer_reviews.title: A true "peace of mind" purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My son was able to open doors at 14 months because of their poor design. He started being able to open standard round door knobs and locks just a few months later. He notices everything and will find ways to accomplish his will (i.e. used a toy to reach a light switch to turn on the light). I wanted to make sure he couldn't figure this one out. After a few tests, he doesn't even bother trying anymore. He just waits to have the door opened or just spins the "cage" around the knob. I don't have to worry about him randomly going outside or into a bathroom when I'm not looking after him. A true "peace of mind" purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Bryenn L.

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money! I got this for my 2and 3yrs old child, every time when I keep my garage open, they will open the door and sneak out. So I got this to keep them in. The quality of this item super cheap! Very lose and easy to get the product out of the door knob. When they try to open the door the cover fall apart, then what’s the point to have the cover on?
customer_reviews.author: mlin

customer_reviews.title: Finally able to keep my toddler in her room
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old is like Houdini. She can get out of anything and any room. Especially at 1 a. M., 3 a. M., 5 a. M., You get my drift. These door covers help to keep her in her room overnight. I wish they came in different sizes because her doorknob is a little bit larger so it kind of sticks to it other than that they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: K. Micc

customer_reviews.title: Overall, decent.. and a must for any toddler
customer_reviews.text: These are a must, really for anyone with a toddler, because sooner or later they WILL figure out how to open doors, usually before they know better. We have these for our toddler. They're incredibly simple and they just work. They snap together easily and quickly, and do exactly what they're meant to do. They are a bit hard to get off after you put them on but I guess that's not a bad thing - if they're hard for an adult to get off, a toddler has no chance - which is a good thing! Overall, I definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Janos

customer_reviews.title: Works Great For Dementia Patients Too!
customer_reviews.text: My mother is elderly with dementia. At times, she tries to go outside in the middle of the night. I bought one pack of these to try. Just now, I put one of the door knobs covers on a door knob. She has now tried to open the same door three times and is confounded, trying a few minutes, then gives up and goes back to sit in her chair. This is a huge help to me. I can now imagine sleeping better at night with some security preventing her from going outside at night.
customer_reviews.author: Atlantica

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works for its intended purpose. The quality is great, easy to assemble, fit is perfect! I recommend this purchase to all parents. Ideas for use: pantry door, main entrances, inside of child's room, and most of all, master bedroom door!
customer_reviews.author: Nichol M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for escape artists
customer_reviews.text: My two year old granddaughter has finally figured out how to open doors! I read the reviews in on this brand and they appeared very positive. I have no regrets. These work great. Perfect fit for standard size door knobs. No more worries about her getting into places she shouldn’t be like the garage or opening the front door to strangers. Adults and teens have no problem getting in and out with these child proof knobs. I will most likely buy more for the upstairs rooms
customer_reviews.author: SandyD

customer_reviews.title: Design is a little hard to grip
customer_reviews.text: We already had some doorknob covers but I ordered these because my wife wanted me to try a different design. Our previous ones had some rubber grippies that we had to squeeze to grip the knob. We thought it would be easier to have these with the holes. Turns out we like the ones with the grippies better as they are easier to use. The other concern I have with these is that with young kids sleeping we often need to "sneak" into the room while they're sleeping. Its really hard to grab these and get your fingers in the holes without it loudly rattling on the door knob.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: These definitely do the job. Our toddlers have not been able to enter any room as long as these things stay on the knob. They are easy enough to snap on, and not too difficult to take off. My only complaint is that one of our toddlers was able to occasionally unsnap the clasps by pulling at the holes, and remove these covers from the door. As some reviewers suggested, this problem was quickly fixed by putting a bit of packing tape either over the holes or over the seam. He hasn’t been able to get it off since. And we have since ordered 2 more sets so we could cover the doors in the rest of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Vijay and Alison

customer_reviews.title: Great until your toddler figures it out.
customer_reviews.text: At first, these were great. Then, my two year old figured out that she can still open a door by pulling on these, causing enough friction to turn the knob. Fixed that with a little soap for times it was really important. But now, and mind you she's still a 2 year old, she's figured out how to get her thumb in one side and finger in another hole and turn the actual knob. At best these gave us about a year before she outsmarted them. My suggestion, get little hook and latch locks, or chain locks, for the doors that really matter. They are a little more, but your toddler can't unlock what they can't reach.
customer_reviews.author: eroo

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: My kid doesn't like these, my husband and I love them. The only thing is, and it's not the product's problem, is that our front door's knob is a slimmer depth than all of our other knobs and has a rounded edge. So our fingers come in contact with only 1/4" on that knob vs 5/8" on the others. It ends up requiring a skillful, unnatural grip to get that one open through the baby proofing. If you have shallow or rounded door knobs throughout your house, you might not find these easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Gogh Me

customer_reviews.title: Infuriates my 2-year-old
customer_reviews.text: My 2-year-old learned how to open the front and back doors, so we got this to stop him from going outside on his own. We put them on when he wasn't around. When he saw them and tried unsuccessfully to open the door, he got quite upset. "Who put this here? I don't like this. I wanna take it off." Which means it worked great! The only issue I have is that it can come off relatively easily. Our door got inadvertently slammed into the wall while our door stopper wasn't there and the cover cracked right off. But that's not usually a problem since we normally have door stoppers.
customer_reviews.author: bewarm

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on my friends' doors and is sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This product is an excellent escape deterrent for dementia adults. I had to do a "Macgiver" on mine because the doorknob i needed it for was too small. Gave the rest to a friend and i watched her put them on and thought for sure she was going to break it but it never broke. I saw her son unable to open the door no matter how hard he tried. This product works great and the seller is awesome. They gave me a refund even though i did not request one.
customer_reviews.author: IslandPrincess

customer_reviews.title: Product almost as good as customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Product is well designed and will probably fit any doorknob. I inadvertently filled out a return on these which was supposed to be for another product. In less than 24 hours, I was emailed by their customer service stating they would do anything to set things right. WOW. Talk about customer service. With a great product and even better customer service, I highly recommend these child proof guards and this company. If I have a choice in the future, I will patronize this company before buying from others.
customer_reviews.author: NealOh

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.text: These covers definitely keep my toddlers out of rooms and closets they have no business in. They are a little flimsy compared to higher prices brands, but they're amazing for the price. When I first opened the package one of them did pop (think plastic egg when squeezed too hard) but was easily clicked back together. When visitors come, they do find it very difficult to open the doors themselves (I child-proofed the bathrooms too) but it's fine if I just open it for them. No big deal. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable incase of fire
customer_reviews.text: These had great reviews. We have standard door knobs. I have lots of experience with baby proof door knobs, and we put these on after a move. We have used them for 3 weeks. The good news is, the baby cannot get out haha they work! But neither can anyone else without some serious effort. The hole should be closer to the fat part of the knob. I’m concerned in the event of a fire, our 10 year old would not be able to exit. I’m ordering the ones with the rubber grippers instead. Sorry to the manufacturer, I respect the hustle! Needs some improvements tho.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to keep my 1.5 year old from opening his closet all the time and throwing everything out of it. They work and super easy to install and easy to take off the handle for me. The only reason I gave 4 stars, is because my mother who has arthritis, cannot use the door handle now. I saw someone asked if people with arthritis can use them and unfortunately she wasn’t able to. I would still recommend these to other parents though.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: basic and with a few things to keep in mind...
customer_reviews.text: These will work as advertised on most door knobs. They snap on over the knob and make it difficult for little hands to turn the knob and open the door. If you have round smaller door knobs, these will be more cumbersome since they won't fit well on the knob. Also, I'm not sure why something like this is so expensive - it seems to me the price is steep for what you actually get here. If the end result is that you want to make it hard for little ones to open a door, this product will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: buff-smartbuyer

customer_reviews.title: would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had mixed emotions when I purchased these since there were a lot of mixed reviews. They keep my baby out of things tho and that was my main concern. They were easy to install and just spin if you aren't opening the door correctly. Also not difficult to remove either. There is a bit of a learning curve to getting the doorknob to open correctly tho and if your fingers are to big its almost impossible to get it to turn the knob. Would be horrible if there was a fire!
customer_reviews.author: Walkers

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy to use, & works.
customer_reviews.text: First Impression Review: These are a super simple design and do the trick! I was thrilled to move to a new house with all knob style doors because they're easier to baby proof. We can finally reduce the number of gates we need and save our toes from brutal stubbings and actual breakage of toe bones by just keeping the door shut with this handy knob cover. My clever toddler hasn't figured it out yet. I'll surely update if these fail me within a week or two.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble/use & really works
customer_reviews.text: Takes seconds to assemble (don’t even need to read instructions it’s so easy — it comes in 2 pieces that clearly line up around the doorknob and snap together). Easy to use as long as you don’t have any issue using your thumb and preferably middle finger to open the door with. Quickly becomes second nature. My toddler is unable to open the door with these, we have them on all of our doorknobs. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: De

customer_reviews.title: Pieces are very hard to fit together
customer_reviews.text: I picked this set of door knob covers because of the positive reviews. However, I find them very hard to install, you almost have to squeeze them until they feel like breaking in order for them to click together, and even then, there are parts of the cover that you have to fiddle with and maneuver until they click. It doesn't cover door locks on the knob so after day 1, my daughter had locked herself in her room. They are almost impossible to get off. I had to break them to get them off. Overall, it was not a pleasant experience and a product that I wish I hadn't gotten.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Kobza

customer_reviews.title: 1yr old is not happy he cannot open the garage door anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on my Kwikset attached garage door handle. My 1 yr old finally figured out how to open the door and was driving us nuts. This device works, he wasn't too happen not to be able to open it anymore. It spins and spins. As for how easy it is for adults to open, we have had no problem. Our 14yr old and 5yr old can handle it fine, though the 5yr old takes a few more seconds than the rest of us. Great item!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with this product. I tried other products when my son was 2 and he figured out how to remove them from the doorknob after two weeks. Fast forward six years to my two year old daughter who is super smart and has figured her way out of different scenarios. She has yet to figure out how to get passed these doorknob covers. In fact, since they have been a huge success, I ordered another pack. Recently, I ordered a third pack (which should finish the doors in my house). I definitely recommend these over the SafetyFirst brand or others.
customer_reviews.author: Jedi Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Seems like good product, WILL NOT FIT MANY STANDARD KNOBS
customer_reviews.text: Depending on the design of your knob, this might not fit them. Not sure why they made the inside diameter so small, but it won't fit about around the shaft of the knob on most of the knobs around my house, my brothers house, my parents house. Only fit on 2 doors that had thinner "shafts". Great product, works perfectly on the doors that it fit on (unfortunately not the doors I needed them for).
customer_reviews.author: Romteni

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: We recently put the toddler rail on my 2 year old’s crib. He didn’t waste any time teaching himself how to open doors shortly thereafter. We bought these to help keep him at bay overnight and he figured them out with ease. I don’t know if I’m more impressed with his ability to figure it out, or more disappointed in the performance of these door handles. I’m assuming their ineffectiveness is due to the design of my door handles or something but I was bummed regardless. Back to amazon they go.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and our toddler removed them!
customer_reviews.text: We just got these in the mail - we’ve been waiting for them! Our 2.5 year old is getting into everything. We put them our doors and within seconds she was able to pop them open just by pulling on it. We have the other brand on most of our doors (Safety First I think) and she’s never managed to make those budge! These are clearly a thinner plastic and just overall they look cheap. Returning! Bad purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Brady Amundson

customer_reviews.title: Bad designed junk.
customer_reviews.text: To separate the 2 halves for installing on the doorknob, you better put on some gloves to save your hands. To place on the doorknob and press the 2 halves back together, better be patient. Very aggravating ! When trying to turn the doorknob, it's very difficult to get enough finger contact on the knob to turn it, Anyway, I threw all 4 of them in the garbage. Not worth the effort to go thru the return process.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M

customer_reviews.title: They work very well, but a very difficult to ...
customer_reviews.text: They work very well, but a very difficult to take off (I know that's intended), but I broke half of them when I needed to remove them when we were moving. You're supposed to pinch in on the plastic part to take them off, but they don't pinch in far enough to properly separate because of the door knob..
customer_reviews.author: Julie Richards

customer_reviews.title: Little Monster Miracle!
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled to keep my child from entering rooms he did not need to be in. I needed to be able to get work done without worrying about him getting in trouble. These knob covers have been a life saver. I placed them on my front door, master bedroom, guest bedroom, and bathroom. I only left his bedroom door unlocked. My kiddo still cannot figure them out! I plan on purchasing more! If anyone has a busy little monster and would like to breathe for a moment, purchase these door locks. They have made my life easier!
customer_reviews.author: burnt7turd

customer_reviews.title: Don't by this Brand if you have a very smart toddler.
customer_reviews.text: I only Purchased this item basically one time, Amazon delivery my first order to wrong address That's an issue of it's own. I thought it was another brand , which fitted the door with ease, This band very loose but may do job for a 1 year old. This 2 year old already knows how to take these things off. Ladies if you have long nails you will be the one that have the problem. Not worth the money plastic all over my floor.
customer_reviews.author: Sonnolo EssChild

customer_reviews.title: Sleek look and awesome safety
customer_reviews.text: I thought all door covers were pretty much the same until I bought these. They function amazing! They look sleek and are a true white. Lastly, they don’t poo off easily. It takes some work to get the knob cover open which is great since my little one tries to get the door covers off. I’m actually buying more to replace the others I have installed already. Great buy and great seller.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Works for flat door knobs also!
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly for our very tall 1.5 year old who can now open doors. It will be a while before he can physically open the door with these guards on there. I couldn't find anything that specifically said they work on flat door knobs (all the information said they for sure worked on the spherical ones), but they do! Will be buying more for the rest of the house :)
customer_reviews.author: Darla4021

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: These were the second batch of door covers I bought. The first ones (Safety first) had holes that were too small and wouldn’t fit my knobs. Who knew there were different sizes? These, however, did not have that problem. The holes were nice and big and a snap (literally) to put together. I installed all four in about 3 minutes. My little one can now safely move about the house as they are on the front and back doors and cleaning closet.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyne S. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my daughter out of places
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (18-month-old) loves to get into everything so I got this doorknob covers to keep her out of bathrooms etc. It's very easy to install, basically, you just have to push two parts together around the knob. While it's impossible for her (or even for my 4-year-old) to open the door with this on the knob it's very easy for an adult. Also if you want to remove it you just squeeze it together and the 2 parts open up. very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Baledi

customer_reviews.title: Really works for me
customer_reviews.text: I’ll be honest, I thought this was too silly at first, like why?! But then my son started walking and I like to stay with him in his playroom. I close the door because otherwise he is nonstop all over the house and man he tires me up lol so he started to learn how to open the door and I figured I needed this. It’s probably one of the easiest to open/close/use baby proof thing in the house and still my little one can’t get it. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Gi Lawlor

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These work great and keep my two toddlers out of rooms/pantries I don't want them in. They take a minute to get used to but they are easy to open door with the cover on. To take off, the best thing I have found is line up the cover so the line is horizontal across the knob facing you and then apply a little pressure down to make them pop off. So far my kids haven't figured this out yet.
customer_reviews.author: S_Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great for Special Needs Escape Artist!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old daughter has been escaping out the front and back doors. We cannot hear her and she will wander. These are perfect to stop that!! I was considering an alarm system or moving door knobs higher up. Very cheap solution to a HUGE problem. She cannot figure them out and everyone else can come and go with no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Julie P.

customer_reviews.title: Serves Its Intended Purpose Very Well
customer_reviews.text: My husband is showing signs of mild dementia and had begun to talk about needing to go outside for reasons that don't make sense. I was very concerned about him trying to accomplish that by himself as his mobility is quite limited. This gives me some peace of mind as it is easy for me to go in and out but his hand strength and coordination is not sufficient to manage the knob now.
customer_reviews.author: BrendaJ

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old pulled these apart and took off the door knob in less than ten minutes of putting them on. Not made well at all. Very disappointed in this product and frustrated I spent money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Nevaeh

customer_reviews.title: Must have product when child proofing!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! We bought a 4-pack as soon as we saw our 2 year old opening the door that leads into the garage. They are so great, that I just bought another 4-pack! Now all of our doors are child proofed... and because of the shape of the knob covers, our doors still looks good. The knobs are easy to open (as an adult) and I am so happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: katie b

customer_reviews.title: Perfect  - Easy -gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. Great price. Keeping my little one of storage closets/ laundry rooms. Just simply click them on. An older child will figure out most likely but my 2.5 year hasn’t yet! Also highly recommend the Jool fold up blue potty seat. I have had two for the past six months - one for home and one for on the go. Works great. I’m 2 for 2 with the company :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old ripped one off within ten minutes
customer_reviews.text: So, I did take the time to ensure I had them on properly, my daughter managed to rip one of them off the door immediately. She grabbed the small circle where we grab the actual handle, and pulled. While she is indeed big and strong for her age, I feel like it certainly shouldn't be THAT easily removed. The very small tabs that hold these in place may be to blame here.
customer_reviews.author: Daman H

customer_reviews.title: great and cheap
customer_reviews.text: This works as advertised. I have 2 3 year old nephews who love going into rooms they should go into. since Toys r us is going, amazon is the go to place for kids stuff now. these door knob covers are great since my stubborn nephews dont know how to use these and my technologically impaired mother does know how to use these. also extra bonus for the opening of the door locks being wide and accessible.
customer_reviews.author: patricio robles

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install safety for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: We put these on the outside of the bathroom door in our toddlers room, front door and door to the garage, and linen closet where we store cleaners. They are super easy to install (and remove) and our toddler hasn’t been able to open the doors after a few months of use yet easy enough for the grandparents to not get trapped- haha! Great value and they don’t look to tacky either.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBirdTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: I knew they worked when I heard Dad yell. ...
customer_reviews.text: I knew they worked when I heard Dad yell... "help! there's a lock on the door!". I bought these for my Dad who has dementia and tries to leave out in the middle of the night. I have to admit I did krazy glue them together to be safe, but he was not able to figure out the trick to open the door.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Work well in theory, bad in practice
customer_reviews.text: They work well but they’re even difficult for me to open occasionally especially because our knobs are stiff to begin with. If there’s anything on your fingers like oil or butter, or even water, it’s difficult to turn the knob. I thought the handle would be squeezable to grip the knob but you have to use your fingers in a pinching motion to turn the knob.
customer_reviews.author: Sitpaintandplay

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in these - we had bought a different brand in the past and these seemed comparable in price and reviews but definitely are not in quality or ease of use. They are flimsy, very difficult to install and if your door has any resistance, impossible to use. We are returning them for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my toddler from breaking out of her room.
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for the escaping toddler. My daughter is 2 and figured out how to open her bedroom door, we were very concerned for safety as our front door has a similar handle too and we didn’t want her getting out at night. We ordered these right away and put them on her door, the front door and our bathroom doors. Very easy to use for adults but she cannot figure it out. Keeping her safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jena Miao

customer_reviews.title: Economical and easy
customer_reviews.text: These are economical and work with all the doorknobs in my house, which are just standard builder grade knobs. At first I found them hard to remove, but if you just give them a squeeze on the seams they unsnap very easily. I liked them so much (and kept finding new doors she needed to stay out of) I came back and bought a second pack.
customer_reviews.author: wildebeest

customer_reviews.title: Effective solution
customer_reviews.text: This are the most convenient solution I have found for baby proofing interior door knobs. One the product is one the door knob it is impossible for a 24 month old to open the door. Also, the product only make it slight more effort for an adult to open the door. Installing is done without tools and simply involves long up the two halves of the product and snapping together. It’s a bit tricky but tidally doable. Removing takes a bit of force
customer_reviews.author: Tori P.

customer_reviews.title: First thing my kid did was rip one of these ...
customer_reviews.text: First thing my kid did was rip one of these off. He is almost 2. Since then he has left them alone and they work as they should keeping his little hands off the door knob. I think this is only because he does not want to "break" them again. He is very strong for his age and determined.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Need strong fingertips
customer_reviews.text: This product will not work unless you have really strong finger tips. Sounds ridiculous but it is true. You can only open the door with these on with the tip of your thumb and the tip of your pointer finger. I have pain in my thumb and this is impossible to open. Poor design. I have used other similar products and an adult can grip the doorknob and open as normal.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Worked for us, keeps our grandson out of rooms we dont want him in
customer_reviews.text: Works great..got these when my grandson started walking and now hes almost three and there still on the doors that we dont want him opening. Us adults have no trouble opening them but he has not figured it out as if yet. We did put clear tape on the seams so he couldn't pull them apart..once in awhile he will just spin them
customer_reviews.author: loralee

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: My child can’t take these off like other brands. It’s great. We have them on the doors to go outside as an extra step to slow our kid down . He is 8 and has special needs. He has learned all the locks so this helps slow him down for us to get to him and redirect him to something new. He has not been able to open them at all. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: These door knob covers are awful...
customer_reviews.text: ...said our 2 year old when we put them on every doorknob to all the places she shouldn’t be going. With 4 tiny clicks and about 7 seconds worth of labor did we ruin our child’s existence and curiousity. One of them is on our pantry door and as it turns out these things are also great at keeping grandparents away from eating our favorite snacks during the day while they watch our kids as well. No more telling her to stay out of her sisters room either because she literally couldn’t if she wanted to. A+ product.
customer_reviews.author: s.

customer_reviews.title: Actually works! Out smarts 3 year old !
customer_reviews.text: These are most effective to stop 3 year old grandson from visiting all the neighbors without my knowledge! Also keeps him out of closets and rooms he doesn’t need to expore! Adult friendly.... ! I like these.. easy to snap on and easy to remove. Good product. UPDATE: To attest that these work and I love them...I just received a second pkg (very fat speedy service).. Well packed and safe!). Good Seller, Good Product
customer_reviews.author: cece2425

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a knob cover that fits like it's suppose to!!
customer_reviews.text: We have been trying & trying to find door knob covers that fit... we have standard size door knobs... but other brands when tried were so tight on the knob rendering them totally useless. These knobs fit perfectly, spin like they are suppose to so little toddler hands can't get pressure on the knob to turn it. They snap together nice & tight. We are very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: LLL

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: These are a life saver! My daughter recently learned how to open doors and I needed something quick and decently priced so I ordered these. I’ve had them for a few weeks and she can’t figure out how to open doors (yet). I ever had an adult ask how to open the door haha. If I need more I will definitely repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Keeps all children and most adults out.
customer_reviews.text: These installed easily and worked far better than any other doorknob cover I've used in terms of preventing children from opening doors they're not supposed to. However, they were borderline too good as my wife couldn't open the doors either and, if I had damp/oily hands, neither could I. They also installed very easily but if I attempted to remove them to swap doors, I broke at least one clip every time, rendering the cover useless. They were however fairly priced, so I will likely just order new ones so I can cover all doors needed without swapping covers between doors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Child proof but not adult proof
customer_reviews.text: After 3 mornings of our toddler meeting us in the hallway it was time to buy some door knob covers. These covers have worked wonderfully. Now instead of meeting our son in the hallway, he now bangs on the door yelling momma! Momma! I am planning on putting these covers on our pantry door knobs that don’t rotate but you pull them open like a French door closet. They are easy to put on but a bit tough to pull off. You really have to give it some strength to open it. It’s also super easy for an adult to open the door with the cover on. Overall very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Appell

customer_reviews.title: Easy operation (but not TOO easy)
customer_reviews.text: These are great knob covers. We also ordered the Dreambaby covers and the Jool ones are MUCH better! I know the idea is for the knobs to be difficult for little hands to open but the Dreambaby ones made it difficult for anyone to operate! The Jool knob covers prevent our very creative 2 year old from escaping while still allowing adults to operate the door without too much grief. The holes for your fingers to grip the knob are actually big enough for adult fingers! Hooray!
customer_reviews.author: Laurel R.

customer_reviews.title: Works great but depends on the type of doorknob and lock.
customer_reviews.text: They work as advertised.. however... they kind of work too well haha. It depends on the doorknob... ours are nice heavy metal ones that are already kind of stiff so these make some of them unusable. Also, if there is a push button lock thing, it can accidentally lock the door sometimes so be aware of that. Otherwise they work great.
customer_reviews.author: BHoodie

customer_reviews.title: Child Proof or Adult Proof?
customer_reviews.text: We love these door covers. Our child has not been able to figure out how to use them and they work great. Easy to put on and move to other doors if necessary. We purchased 3 packs over the past year to cover all important rooms. Sometimes they are difficult for an adult to figure out as well, but after some practice they are no problem.
customer_reviews.author: hlschu

customer_reviews.title: You wanna piss off your toddler, buy these
customer_reviews.text: My 7yo can open the doors, but my little 2yo stinker can’t. I have enjoyed watching the 2yo get über angry that he can’t enter and destroy the room he wishes to. 10 for 10
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Gilman

product_meta.title: Door Knob Covers - 4 Pack - Child Safety Cover - Child Proof Doors by Jool Baby
feature_bullets: Deter children from opening doors or getting locked in a room with a door knob cover.
Compatible with standard spherical doorknobs. Fits more door knobs than any competing product.
Our door knob safety cover features a subdued, unobtrusive design that blends into your room design.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,367 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
